RatePopup.text:
Do you like DaKanji?
If that is the case a rating would be awesome and it would help this project alot!

tutorial.undo: Press to undo the last stroke
tutorial.predictions: The predicted characters will be shown here
tutorial.short_press_prediction: A short press copies the prediction
tutorial.long_press_prediction: A long press opens the prediction in a dictionary
tutorial.multi_search: Here you can search multiple characters at once
tutorial.double_tap_prediction: A Double Tap adds the character to the search box
tutorial.multi_search_short_press: A short press copies the characters to the clipboard
tutorial.multi_search_long_press: A long press opens the characters in a dictionary
tutorial.multi_search_double_tap: A double tap empties the field
tutorial.multi_search_swipe_left: Swiping left on this field deletes the last character
tutorial.dictionary_settings: In the settings the translation service can be chosen

SettingsScreen.use_default_browser_for_online_dictionar: Use a webview for web dictionaries
SettingsScreen.title: Settings

advanced_settings.drawing_inference_backend: Inference backend (the app needs to be restarted)
advanced_settings.title: Advanced settings

AboutScreen.title: about
AboutScreen.about_text:
DaKanji helps students of the Japanese language and people who use it.
Right now it can recognize handwritten characters:

- all 漢字 from 漢字検定
- ひらがな (also historical ones: ゑ, etc.)
- カタカナ (also historical ones: ヱ, etc.)

But the feature set will be vastly improved in the coming releases.

A desktop version is available [here.](GITHUB_DESKTOP_REPO)
The app was developed using dart with the Flutter framework and is source available.
If you want to learn more about the development of the app, [visit its GitHub repository.](GITHUB_MOBILE_REPO)
If you want to learn more about the machine learning models powering this app, [take a look here.](GITHUB_ML_REPO)

Also check out [my other apps.](DAAPPLAB_STORE_PAGE)
If you have problems using this app or suggestions how to improve it please report them [here](GITHUB_ISSUES) or join the [discord server.](DISCORD_SERVER)

The privacy police can be found [here](PRIVACY_POLICE)
